issue.title: Error: The gulp task detection didn't contribute a task for the following configuration
issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30 (Nov 14 build)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone https://github.com/LoneSimba/RCSE.git
2. (Optional) Change anything in /public_html/themes/RCS/pages/main_template/*.scss
3. Try running "Terminal->Run Task", it will output "Error: The gulp task detection didn't contribute a task for the following configuration" and the rest of it.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

This does not happen on Windows, but always occur on Ubuntu (at least, never tested on other Linux systems). Is there a way over this trouble, or just work with SCSS on Windows?

comment.body: @dbaeumer sorry for not responding, have been busy a little. Gulp is installed both globally and locally on both Win and Ubuntu

issue.title: Bug: Markdown, U+2028, and "Go to Symbol in File..."
issue.body:
Suppose you take the following file, except that the line containing `foo` also contains `U+2028` somewhere in it.

```markdown
# A
- foo

# B
- bar
```

`vscode` will render `U+2028` as a question mark in a diamond, and the list of symbols that appear in the 'Go to Symbol in File...'  popup will be shifted (by the number of `U+2028` characters present in the file). Screenshots that illustrate this are below.

![screen shot 2018-11-25 at 19 03 03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10088591/48983289-c9951300-f0e4-11e8-83dc-f527226c95f7.png)

![screen shot 2018-11-25 at 19 03 08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10088591/48983290-c9951300-f0e4-11e8-93cc-ccd5b77478c4.png)

(Why did this come up? If you triple-click ' felicita - hej! ' in [this link](https://www.residentadvisor.net/reviews/22851), and paste it into `vscode`, it actually has a pair of enclosing `U+2028` characters. It seems unique to that page...)

issue.title: Merging support when pull from remote
issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Currently the interface provided from vscode in order to perform basic git actions is more than sufficient. But still when you want to pull form a remote repo and the delta is big, even though you see that there are unmerged files, there is not easy way to discover and merge the files. Most of the times you have to go to git support tab and from there try to commit the pulled changes and discover the merge requests. 
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
The interface should be enhanced, so that when there are conflicts to be merged , that is much more clear on the user interface. Also Instead of doing it in line on the editor it would be nicer to have split two column editor where in the middle you can merge and see the final outcome before saving and finalizing the merging. I know referring to features of another  IDE is not always the best, but I firmly believe the git support of IntelliJ and in general IDEA family IDE's is something extremely intuitive

issue.title: PHP Xdebug not working
issue.body:
Hi, I'm using VSCODE in Ubuntu 18.04. I have php and xdebug installed, and they are both working (!).
It just happens that Xdebug does not receive my code! I'll tell you how I know: if I run
   netstat --listen | grep 9000
the result is an empty line. If I launch the debugger in vscode and run the same command again, the output is
   tcp6       0      0 [::]:9000               [::]:*                  LISTEN 
In vscode, the debug console becomes active: if I write "Is Xdebug working?" (without the quotes), the answer is "Cannot evaluate code without a connection". If I write "printf("Hello World!");" the answer is "Cannot evaluate code without a connection". Well... the connection is alive, is just does not get my code :-(.
I tried several things, namely, using putty to create ssh tunnels over port 9000. No Joy!

Any idea what might be wrong? phpinfo() returns the usual correct status, php -v reports that Xdebug is active... it simply is not receiving my code...

Best regards,
Licínio Nunes

comment.body: Please ask this question on Stackoverflow or file this question against the PHP extension repo.

issue.title: Always scroll a complete line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

issue.body:
If you scroll via mouse wheel the editor should always scroll a complete line.

![half_line](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8401876/40648937-f7a7f99e-632f-11e8-8691-1fe1ab36b6a7.jpg)

As you can see, line 6 is not completly visible, while scrolling with the mouse wheel the complete line should snap in.

EDIT: The same happens when scrolling via cursor keys or scroll bar.

comment.body: But now scrolling with my trackpad is painfully slow. All my other apps scroll just fine, at reasonable speed. What happened to scrolling in VSC???

issue.title: The Tab completion cannot be disabled by setting.json
issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.25.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open "Setting" 
2. Set `editor.tabCompletion` to `false`.
3. Set `editor.acceptSuggestionOnEnter` to `"off"`
4. Save and resume VSCode, the suggestion or completion still will be accepted when the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key is pressed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38714576/48976317-4d88d400-f0c0-11e8-8384-de2d0508ecbe.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38714576/48976324-7315dd80-f0c0-11e8-858d-4477bd786cd1.png)

comment.body:
@jrieken, how about renaming this option since it's definitely not intuitive to `snippetTabCompletion`
 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9698#issuecomment-235228173

issue.title: Provide support to synchronize settings across machines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

issue.body:
There are quiet some extensions out there to handle setting synchronization between multiple computers. And in my opinion they are very important: Since vscode is very customizable with settings, keyboardshortcuts and extension it is very hard to synchronize those things between multiple workstations. And all those extensions are not really clean solutions, because vscode does nearly nothing to support them (for example the paths vscode uses are not exposed, see #2741).

So here some ideas to make synchronization clean and extensible:
- add a contribution point for synchronization extensions
  - Those extensions should not have to gather all the files that have to be synced. vscode should do this and then pass them to the extensions
  - Such an extension's job is only to upload/download the files, passed to them (so we can have the `gist upload`/`svn upload`/`git repo upload`/`dropbox`/`filesystem`/`onedrive`/`ftp`/`other services`.
  - Or maybe gather all settings into one big json object and pass that.
  - Support versioning and non versioning extensions
- add a remote_settings.json to build on top of the workspace-settings/user-settings stack.
- allow automatic and user triggered synchronization

Ok... just some ideas :smile:

issue.title: Cannot reliably save files on Linux samba share
issue.body: VS Code version: Code 1.28.2 Samba version: 3.6.23 Issue Type: Bug - This issue is similar to issues 12232 and 15113. - Files are stored on a Linux server and accessed over a local network using a samba share. - Upon saving changes to a file, "Failed to save : Insufficient permissions." error dialog box appears. - "Retry as Admin..." is clicked. - Same error dialog box reappears each time "Retry as Admin..." is clicked. - File permissions and file ownership are correct: 644 and apache:apache (web server user/group). - Dialog box appears even if file permissions are temporarily changed to 777 and same user/group. - Changes on disk are saved correctly despite the errors shown. This issue has been occurring for the past 3 to 4 months. However, since the VS Code 1.28.2 update, the dialog box will not go away until "X" is clicked. Prior to the current update, the error dialog box would appear a maximum of two or three times, followed by a "Compare" button. The copy on disk would always be identical to the copy in VS Code. ![retry-as-admin-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15024151/47685873-7a1b0000-db95-11e8-845d-ada59a46a61d.png)

issue.title: Windows terminal issues caused by winpty
issue.body:
This is a meta issue to act as a central place for all winpty issues.

## Legend

| Icon | Meaning
|---|---
| ✔️ | Workaround in place
| ✖️ | Still an issue

## General

- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29540 Random native exceptions
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/42847 Output being dropped for some programs (not confirmed)
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26375 Resizing the terminal will duplicate lines (and generally corrupt the current viewport)
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/47088 Lines are duplicated when viewport is narrow
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/45682 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19785 Various issues with sub-shells like ghci/python
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/45516 Running ssh doesn't properly interpret escape sequences
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/45693 Characters get stuck in viewport in wrong spot in PowerShell
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/45693 2 spaces are added when space is pressed when launched with the cmder init script

## Foreground/background color

- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/40327 Text color goes crazy when running certain commands
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/41195 Invisible text in some programs
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32648 QR codes in terminal printed with background color don't show
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/46397 https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/535 PowerShell colors don't work as expected (I suspect winpty is to blame for this)
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/47073 Powerlines doesn't display correctly

## Process killing / ctrl+c

- ✖️ https://github.com/Tyriar/node-pty/issues/7 Ctrl+C doesn't do anything, is unreliable or breaks the viewport
- ✖️ https://github.com/Tyriar/node-pty/issues/168 Ctrl+C presents "Terminate batch job (Y/N)" but it looks like it kills the process regardless
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26807 The process tree is not killed properly when winpty is killed, the current fix which doesn't seem to work for all cases is to get the console process tree and forcefully kill it
- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/43557 Due to the way we kill the process tree this is preventing the shells from shutting down gracefully and retaining their history

## Clearing

- ✖️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/33730 Clearing the terminal doesn't work in git bash
- ✖️ https://github.com/xtermjs/xterm.js/issues/106 winpty does not trigger a clear scrollback when `cls` is run

## Tasks

- ✔️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32042 Line are pre-wrapped by winpty so we are forced to guess where lines are wrapped
- ✔️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/44192 Clearing the screen can redraw lines multiple times

## Windows regressions

These issues slipped into stable Windows and took month(s) to get a fix to users as a result.

- ✔️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19665 Broken text layout
- ✔️ https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/36630 IOError in Python

comment.body: I was redirected here by another user, but the issue at #26375 has also happened outside of vscode (In my case, it is the terminal of Ubuntu), so it likely to be some OS bug.

issue.title: Weird issue when the terminal's width is small?
issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.29.1 (It's happened before, but still persists to this version)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. "cd" to a really long path
2. Resize the window to the smallest (the bug happens depend on the length of the above path)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Please take a look at the terminal screen (This is after a 'clear' command has been executed).
![screenshot from 2018-11-25 12-48-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39618961/48975975-98025480-f0b0-11e8-9d62-8feb88fb2091.png)
